statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

header.gameNote: HALL OF FAME TIP-OFF TOURNAMENT AT SPRINGFIELD MA

article.description: Novar Gadson scored 18 points, making four 3-pointers, as Rider defeated Loyola Marymount 73-63 on Sunday.
article.headline: Rider shoots its way past Loyola Marymount
article.linkText: Rider shoots its way past Loyola Marymount
article.story: SPRINGFIELD, Mass. -- Novar Gadson scored 18 points, making four 3-pointers, as Rider defeated Loyola Marymount 73-63 on Sunday. The Broncs (4-1) were 11 of 19 from 3-point range (57.9 percent) in their third straight win and second in the Hall of Fame Tip-Off. Rider trailed 38-37 at halftime before taking its first lead of the game on Mike Ringgold's layup 17 seconds into the second half. The Lions (2-3) answered on a jumper, but the Broncs then took control, scoring the next seven points. After a strong-shooting first half in which they shot 53.6 percent (15 of 28), the Lions were held to 9-of-34 shooting (26.5 percent) in the second half. Ringgold finished with 16 points on 8-for-11 shooting and Anthony Myles added 10 for Rider. Loyola Marymount was led by Drew Viney with 17 points. Ashley Hamilton and Anthony Ireland added 14 and 12 points, respectively.
